intro: Hibiscus brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and its stems are thick and often woody. Hibiscus brachypus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
